    public class Truck
extends AbstractVehicle
    Represents a truck.

    15 October 2014
    Author:
    Jonathan Hughes

      • canPass

        public boolean canPass(Terrain theTerrain,
                       Light theLight)
        Returns whether or not this truck may move onto the given type of terrain, when the street lights are the given color. Behavior: Returns true when it is on a street or at any color of light. Returns whether or not this vehicle may move onto the given type of terrain, when the street lights are the given color.

      • chooseDirection

        public Direction chooseDirection(java.util.Map<Direction,Terrain> theNeighbors)
        Returns the direction this vehicle would like to move, based upon the given map of the neighboring terrain. Behavior: Trucks travel only on streets and through lights. Their preferred movement is to randomly select to go straight, turn left, or turn right. As a last resort, if none of these three directions is legal (all not streets or lights), the truck turns around. Trucks drive through all traffic lights without stopping!
        Specified by:
        chooseDirection in interface Vehicle
        Specified by:
        chooseDirection in class AbstractVehicle
        Parameters:
        theNeighbors - a map of neighboring terrain.
        Returns:
        the direction this vehicle would like to move. the direction this vehicle would like to move. the direction this object would like to move.
